results.title: Joan the woman
results.creator_credit: Cardinal Film Corporation and Cecil B. DeMille
results.brief_description: An English soldier on the Western front in WWI dreams of the Maid of Orleans, Joan of Arc, before he goes into battle. De Mille emphasised the mystical reincarnation theme that appeared in MacPherson’s story by superimposing images of a prophetic angel over the main narrative. He also experimented with a new colour process for the recurrent images of fire. It was charismatic opera diva Geraldine Farrar’s second film with DeMille, made the year after the success of ‘Carmen’ and was the director’s first foray into costume drama. Cast includes Geraldine Farrar, Wallace Reid, Theodore Roberts, Raymond Hatton, Hobart Bosworth. From the story by Jeanie MacPherson. Original 1916 score performed by Christian Elliot.

results.title: Joan of Arc
results.creator_credit: Sierra Pictures, Walter Wanger and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description: Director Victor Fleming’s final film features Ingrid Bergman as a vivid and luminous Joan of Arc, the 15th-century French peasant girl who led the French in battle against the invading British and was consequently burned at the stake for heresy. Based on the stage play ‘Joan of Lorraine’, by Maxwell Anderson. Cast includes Ingrid Bergman, Jose Ferrer, Ward Bond and Francis L. Sullivan.

results.title: Jinxed
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Herb Jaffe and Don Siegel
results.brief_description: A farcical comedy involving professional gambler Harold (Rip Torn) and cabaret singer Bonita (Bette Midler) who spend their time moving from state to state in pursuit of Willie (Ken Wahl), a jinxed croupier who earns them a number of small fortunes. When Bonita and Harold meet and fall in love, the stakes change and a plot to murder Harold ensues. The plot unravels when Harold accidently dies. One is left wondering whether it is Bonita who is really jinxed?

results.title: Jindabyne (A)
results.creator_credit: April Films, Catherine Jarmar and Ray Lawrence
results.brief_description: Based on the Raymond Carver short story “So much water so close to home”, this is a compelling drama about a marriage drawn asunder by a young girl’s murder. Stewart Kane, played by Irish actor Gabrielle Byrne, goes fishing with friends to a remote spot; when he and his friends find a young girl’s mutilated body they continue with their trip, reporting the crime upon their return. Such callousness makes Claire (Laura Linney) question her marriage and her husband’s humanity and she is drawn into a web of intrigue and ethical dilemmas. Expanding upon Carver’s original text, Lawrence examines Aboriginal rites and ceremonies and places, central to the narrative, the uncomfortable relationship between the black and white communities.

results.title: Jimmy Neutron: boy genius
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon Movies, O Entertainment, Steve Oedekerk, John A. Davis and Albie Hecht
results.brief_description: Computer animated sci-fi story about boy genius Jimmy Neutron who unwittingly causes havoc when a satellite launched by him is picked up by an alien species known as Yokians. These strange green aliens invade Jimmy’s hometown Retroville in the dark of night and abduct all the parents in the town leaving it up to Jimmy, along with his robotic dog, Goddard, his best friend Carl Wheezer and his arch rival Cindy Vortex to take to the skies in a rescue bid to save the parents from becoming human sacrifices. Features the voices of Debi Derryberry, Megan Cavanagh, Mark Decarlo, Martin Short and Patrick Stewart.

results.title: Jezebel
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and William Wyler
results.brief_description: On the eve of the Civil War, Julie Marston, a wilful southern belle, does everything in her spiteful power to goad her fiance into a jealous rage. When he is stricken by the plague, she reforms and tries to atone her wicked and sinful ways. Starring Henry Fonda and Bette Davis in her second Best Actress Academy Award performance. Based on the play by Owen Davis Sr.

results.title: Jewel of the Nile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Michael Douglas and Lewis Teague
results.brief_description: Thrill-packed sequel to “Romancing the Stone”. It’s been six months since Joan Wilder (Kathleen Turner) and Jack Colton (Michael Douglas) sailed into the sunset after their first adventure - but it hasn’t all been smooth sailing. Then they learn of the mysterious, priceless Jewel of the Nile, and it’s non-stop excitement as they race to beat villainous Danny de Vito to the treasure.

results.title: Jesus Christ superstar (2000)
results.creator_credit: Really Useful Films and Gale Edwards
results.brief_description: Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice’s rock opera, “Jesus Christ Superstar” is one of the most successful theatrical musicals of all time. The story of Jesus’ Passion is scored to a vibrant, electronic rock beat and is performed by a cast of dancers and singers. This version, following on from Norman Jewison’ 1973 feature film of the same name, is primarily the filming of a stage production, performed in London, 1996-2000. The accent has shifted and stress is now placed on the perspective of Judas, casting him as a man in conflict with Jesus over the direction the cause has taken. Modernisation of the sets and costumes is reflected in the multicultural cast that are dressed in modern garb - including techno gear and Darth Veda-ish masks. The songs however remain the same and it is through their singing that the full tragedy and power of the Passion is realised. Songs include” “Jesus Christ Superstar”, “What’s the Buzz” and “I Don’t Know How to Love Him.” Cast includes Glenn Carter, Jerome Pradon, Renee Castle, Fred Johanson, Rik Mayall, Frederick B. Owens, Michael Shaeffer.

results.title: Jesus' son [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alliance Atlantis, Blue Sky Studios, Evenstar, Elizabeth Cutherell, Lydia Dean Pilcher, David Urrutial, Margot Bridger and Alison MacLean
results.brief_description: Based on Denis Johnson’s acclaimed gritty short story collection, also called “Jesus’ Son”, this a finely observed drama about a young man’s descent into heroin abuse and small-time criminality in the early seventies. Faithfully recreating the drug subculture of the time, and also utilising a loose narrative structure and mise-en-scene that recalls the daring independent work of early 1970s American cinema, “Jesus’ Son” features a rich array of characters who are by turn tragic and comic. Billy Crudup and Samantha Morton are excellent as two young lovers working out their shared dependency on each other and on heroin, and they are well supported by a supporting cast that includes Holly Hunter, Denis Leary and Dennis Hopper. Though the material is harsh and confronting, “Jesus’ Son” also emerges as a deeply optimistic and humane drama. This is an excellent example of a film work that remains true to the mood and emotional intensity of its original source text, but which also creatively re-imagines and develops the story for another medium.

results.title: Jerry Maguire (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gracie Films, James L. Brooks and Cameron Crowe
results.brief_description: Jerry Maguire set Hollywood abuzz in 1996 because it seemed to represent a return to films about people. Jerry Maguire (Tom Cruise) is a sports agent who starts to re-evaluate his success driven life. During a conference Jerry writes out a mission statement under a storm of inspiration, distributing it to everyone. When he gets back to work he discovers he’s been sacked and is left with only one client, Rod Tidwell (Cuba Gooding Jr) and one loyal employee, Dorothy Boyd (Renee Zellweger). Now Jerry has to struggle for his survival both as a sports agent and in his personal life as he is drawn into the lives of Dorothy and her son Ray (Jonathan Lipnicki). Cameron Crowe wrote and directed this heart warming romantic comedy which has lots to say about the commerce driven world we live in. Cuba Gooding Jr received and Oscar for Best Supporting Actor (1997) and Tom Cruise received a Golden Globe Award (1997) for Best Actor in a Comedy/Musical.
